intro: Mapouria humilis, commonly known as the dwarf mapouria, is a low-growing shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are fragrant and attract pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
